member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.Parse(System.String[],Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.IEnvironment)
member.summary:
Options parser support: * Only - and -- prefix for options https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/commandline/syntax#options * Multiple option arguments https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/commandline/syntax#multiple-arguments * Use a space, '=', or ':' as the delimiter between an option name and its argument * escape with \ * surrounding with "" * surrounding with ''
Options parser doesn't support * Default argument/commands/verb * Alias https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/commandline/syntax#aliases * Case sensitivity https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/commandline/syntax#case-sensitivity * -- token https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/commandline/syntax#the----token
https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/V3_chap02.html#tag_18_02_03 https://learn.microsoft.com/cpp/c-language/parsing-c-command-line-arguments?view=msvc-170 Double-Quotes: we don't support for now * The dollar-sign shall retain its special meaning introducing parameter expansion * The backquote shall retain its special meaning introducing the other form of command substitution * A POSIX convention lets you omit the delimiter when you are specifying a single-character option alias, i.e. myapp -vquiet.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.ExitCodes
member.summary: We use positive exit codes for failure because POSIX/BASH exit codes are unsigned 8-bit integers. On POSIX systems the standard exit code is 0 for success and any number from 1 to 255 for anything else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.FNV_1aHashHelper.ComputeStringHash(System.String)
member.summary: Computes a hash of the string using the FNV-1a algorithm. Used by Roslyn.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.ObjectPool`1
member.summary:
Generic implementation of object pooling pattern with predefined pool size limit. The main purpose is that limited number of frequently used objects can be kept in the pool for further recycling.
Notes: 1) it is not the goal to keep all returned objects. Pool is not meant for storage. If there is no space in the pool, extra returned objects will be dropped.
2) it is implied that if object was obtained from a pool, the caller will return it back in a relatively short time. Keeping checked out objects for long durations is ok, but reduces usefulness of pooling. Just new up your own.
Not returning objects to the pool in not detrimental to the pool's work, but is a bad practice. Rationale: If there is no intent for reusing the object, do not use pool - just use "new".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.ObjectPool`1.Factory
member.remarks: Not using System.Func{T} because this file is linked into the (debugger) Formatter, which does not have that type (since it compiles against .NET 2.0).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.ObjectPool`1.Allocate
member.summary: Produces an instance.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.ObjectPool`1.Free(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns objects to the pool.
member.remarks: Search strategy is a simple linear probing which is chosen for it cache-friendliness. Note that Free will try to store recycled objects close to the start thus statistically reducing how far we will typically search in Allocate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.ObjectPool`1.ForgetTrackedObject(`0,`0)
member.summary:
Removes an object from leak tracking.
This is called when an object is returned to the pool. It may also be explicitly called if an object allocated from the pool is intentionally not being returned to the pool. This can be of use with pooled arrays if the consumer wants to return a larger array to the pool than was originally allocated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.IConsole
member.summary: Wraps the static System.Console to be isolatable in tests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Helpers.TimeoutHelper.DefaultHangTimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets defaultAntiHangTimeout* values are used as timeout for every wait operation in the test platform. Are not intended for any timeout logic, but only to avoid infinite waits in case of test platform hangs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.Trace
member.summary: Logs that contain the most detailed messages. These messages may contain sensitive application data. These messages are disabled by default and should never be enabled in a production environment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Logs that are used for interactive investigation during development. These logs should primarily contain information useful for debugging and have no long-term value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.Information
member.summary: Logs that track the general flow of the application. These logs should have long-term value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Logs that highlight an abnormal or unexpected event in the application flow, but do not otherwise cause the application execution to stop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Logs that highlight when the current flow of execution is stopped due to a failure. These should indicate a failure in the current activity, not an application-wide failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.Critical
member.summary: Logs that describe an unrecoverable application or system crash, or a catastrophic failure that requires immediate attention.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.LogLevel.None
member.summary: Not used for writing log messages. Specifies that a logging category should not write any messages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Logging.ServerLoggerForwarder
member.summary: This logger forwards the messages back to the server host so that they're logged over RPC back to the client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Requests.TreeNodeFilter.ParseFilter(System.String)
member.remarks:
The current grammar for the filter looks as follows:
TREE_NODE_FILTER = EXPR ( '/' EXPR )* EXPR = '(' EXPR ')' | EXPR OP EXPR | NODE_VALUE FILTER_EXPR = '(' FILTER_EXPR ')' | TOKEN '=' TOKEN | FILTER_EXPR OP FILTER_EXPR | TOKEN OP = '&' | '|' NODE_VALUE = TOKEN | TOKEN '[' FILTER_EXPR ']' TOKEN = string
member.exception: Exception thrown, if the filter is malformed, for example A(|B) or A).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Requests.TreeNodeFilter.MatchesFilter(System.String,Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Extensions.Messages.PropertyBag)
member.summary: Checks whether a node path matches the tree node filter.
member.param: The segment URL encoded path.
The URL encoded node properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.Resources.PlatformResources.TelemetryNotice
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Telemetry --------- Microsoft Testing Platform collects usage data in order to help us improve your experience. The data is collected by Microsoft and are not shared with anyone. You can opt-out of telemetry by setting the TESTINGPLATFORM_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT or DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT environment variable to '1' or 'true' using your favorite shell.
Read more about Microsoft Testing Platform telemetry: https://aka.ms/testingplatform/telemetry.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.IMessageFormatter
member.summary: A message formatter converts objects into a serialized format and can deserialize data into corresponding objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.IMessageHandler.ReadAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reads the next payload from the client.
member.remarks: The reading is likely backed by a data stream and the message handler is responsible for reading the data stream and deserialization of the message. If the reading from the stream is canceled will throw an exception. If deserialization of the message fails, also will throw an exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.IMessageHandler.WriteRequestAsync(Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.RpcMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Writes the next to the client.
member.remarks: The writing is likely backed by a data stream and the message handler is responsible for writing to the data stream and serialization of the message. If serialization of the message fails, will throw an exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.PerRequestServerDataConsumer
member.summary: This class converts the events send to the message bus and sends these back to the client.

member.summary: An error message is sent if some exception was thrown when processing the request.

member.summary: An response message is sent if a request is handled successfully.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.ResponseMessage.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: An response message is sent if a request is handled successfully.
member.remarks: If the RPC handler returns a the will be returned as null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Testing.Platform.ServerMode.SerializerUtilities.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes static members of the class. Is a known fact that this serializer jsonite based suffer of boxing/unboxing issue but it's only for netstandard2.0 and we don't optimize for it for now. We aim to rewrite all the serialization with the best perfomance using .NET System.Text.Json api inside the Json.cs file.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Gets create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Gets create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Gets the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.summary: Represent a range has start and end indexes.

member.summary: Gets represent the inclusive start index of the Range.

member.name: P:System.Range.End
member.summary: Gets represent the exclusive end index of the Range.

member.name: M:System.Range.#ctor(System.Index,System.Index)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.Construct a Range object using the start and end indexes.
member.param: Represent the inclusive start index of the range.
Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.name: M:System.Range.Equals(System.Range)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another Range object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Range.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Range object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:System.Range.StartAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from start index to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:System.Range.EndAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element in the collection to the end Index.

member.name: P:System.Range.All
member.summary: Gets create a Range object starting from first element to the end.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether gets the condition parameter value.

member.summary: The internal JsonReader used to deserialize a json text into an object graph.

member.name: T:Jsonite.JsonArray
member.summary: The default array used when deserializing to an array type.

member.summary: Instance exception used when a parsing exception occured.

member.name: F:Jsonite.JsonException.Offset
member.summary: Character offset from the beginning of the text being parsed.

member.name: F:Jsonite.JsonException.Line
member.summary: Line position (zero-based) where the error occured from the beginning of the text being parsed.

member.name: F:Jsonite.JsonException.Column
member.summary: Column position (zero-based) where the error occured.

member.summary: Prints the line (1-based) and column (1-based).

member.summary: Defines serialization and deserialization settings used by and

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth used when serializing or deserializing.

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating to indent the text when serializing. Default is false.

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.IndentCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of used to indent a json output when is true.

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.IndentChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent character used when is true.

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.ParseFloatAsDecimal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether floats should be deserialized to decimal instead of double (default).

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.ParseValuesAsStrings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all values should be deserialized to strings instead of numbers.

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.AllowTrailingCommas
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow trailing commas in object and array declaration.

member.name: P:Jsonite.JsonSettings.Reflector
member.summary: Gets or sets the reflector used for interfacing the json text to an object graph.

member.name: T:Jsonite.IJsonReflector
member.summary: A callback interface used during the serialization and deserialization.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.Initialize(Jsonite.JsonSettings)
member.summary: Initializes this instance with the specified settings.
member.param: The settings.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeEnterObject(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object@)
member.summary: Called when starting to deserialize an object.
member.param: An existing object instance (may be null).
The expected type (not null).
The object context that will be passed to other deserialize methods for objects.
member.returns: The object instance to deserialize to. The return value must not be null. This instance can be the input if not null, or this method could choose to replace the instance by another during the deserialization.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializePrepareMemberForObject(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Type@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Called when deserializing a member, before deserializing its value.
member.param: The object context that was returned by the
The object instance (not null).
The member name being deserialized.
Expected type of the member.
The member context that will be passed back to .
The existing member value if any (may be null).

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeSetObjectMember(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when deserializing a member value to effectively set the value for the member on the specified object instance.
member.param: The object context that was returned by the
The object instance (not null).
The member context that was generated by .
The value of the member to set on the object.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeExitObject(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when deserializing an object is done. This method allows to transform the object to another value.
member.param: The object context.
The object instance that has been deserialized.
member.returns: The final object deserialized (may be different from )

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeEnterArray(System.Object,System.Type,System.Type@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Called when starting to deserialize an array.
member.param: An existing array instance (may be null).
The expected type of the array.
The expected type of an array item.
The array context that will be passed to other deserialize methods for arrays.
member.returns: The array instance to deserialize to. The return value must not be null.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeAddArrayItem(System.Object,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when deserializing an array item to add to the specified array instance.
member.param: The array context that was returned by the
The array being deserialized.
The index of the next element (may be used for plain arrays).
The value of the item to add to the array.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeExitArray(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when deserializing an array is done. This method allows to transform the array to another value (transform a list to a plain .NET array for example)
member.param: The array context that was returned by the
The array instance that has been deserialized.
member.returns: The final array instance deserialized (may be different from )

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnDeserializeRaiseParsingError(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Called when an error occured when deserializing. A default implementation should throw a .
member.param: The character position from the begining of the buffer being deserialized.
The line position (zero-based)
The column position (zero-based)
The error message.
An optional inner exception.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnSerializeGetObjectType(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object@)
member.summary: Called when serializing an object, to determine whether the object is an array or a simple object (with members/properties). This method is then used to correctly route to or .
member.param: The object instance being serialized
The type of the object being serialized.
An object context that will be passed to other serialize methods.
member.returns: The type of the specified object instance (array or object or unknown)

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnSerializeGetObjectMembers(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when serializing an object to the members value of this object.
member.param: The object context that was returned by the
The object instance being serialized.

member.name: M:Jsonite.IJsonReflector.OnSerializeGetArrayItems(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when serializing an array to get the array items.
member.param: The object context that was returned by the
The object instance being serialized.
member.returns: An enumeration of the array items to serialize.

member.summary: The object type being serialized is unkwown.

member.summary: The object being serialized is an object with members.
